title: Define Project Requirements for TrafficInspector
description: Thoroughly gather and document the detailed requirements for the TrafficInspector project, including specific features, functionalities, performance criteria, security considerations, integration points with existing systems, scalability and availability requirements, and potential future enhancements. This document should also outline the system architecture and design principles to guide the development team.

title: Design System Architecture for TrafficInspector
description: Design the overall system architecture for TrafficInspector, including the distributed components, communication protocols, data flow, scalability considerations, and security measures. The design should also provide guidelines for interoperability between different VPCs and ensure efficient use of backend security appliances.

title: Plan Security Measures for TrafficInspector
description: Define and document the comprehensive security measures and best practices to be implemented in TrafficInspector. This includes data encryption strategies, access control mechanisms, threat mitigation tactics, and disaster recovery procedures. The plan should also outline methods for continuous monitoring and updating of security protocols.

title: Design Data Storage and Management
description: Design the data storage and management components for TrafficInspector, including a scalable and efficient database schema, data persistence strategies (such as sharding or partitioning), data access mechanisms (RESTful API, GraphQL etc.), data security considerations (encryption at rest, access control etc.), and performance optimization strategies.

title: Plan Deployment and Monitoring
description: Define the deployment strategies, monitoring tools, and infrastructure requirements for TrafficInspector in the distributed environment. Ensure that the deployment plan considers high availability, scalability, and fault tolerance. Identify the appropriate monitoring tools for tracking system health, performance, and security. Determine the infrastructure requirements, such as load balancers, databases, caching layers, and any other necessary components. Consider utilizing containerization and microservices architecture to enhance scalability and resilience. Include strategies for handling data privacy and security concerns.
